description: Validates the functionality of the price filter feature by ensuring users can filter products within a specified price range.
steps: Enter a minimum price in the 'Min price' field using the appropriate input.
Enter a maximum price in the 'Max price' field using the appropriate input.
Click the 'FILTER' button to apply the price filter.
Verify that the product listing updates to display only items within the specified price range.
Ensure the applied filter is reflected in the UI (e.g., updated price range label).
Clear filters and verify products reset to original state.
expected_results: Products displayed match the specified price range.
No products outside the range are displayed.
Filter UI reflects the selected price range.
edge_cases: No products exist within the specified range.
Entering non-numeric values in the price fields.
Setting a maximum price lower than the minimum price.
data_requirements: Predefined price range data for comparison.
Filter functionality enabled on the page.
dependencies: Price filter feature implemented and functional.
UI elements fully rendered and interactive.
api_interactions: Verify backend API updates the product list based on the applied filter.
Ensure API handles edge cases like invalid price ranges.
performance_metrics: Time taken to update product listings after filter application.
accessibility_requirements: Verify labels for input fields are screen-reader compatible.
Test color contrast for filter section.
